title: Having trouble OPENING League to patch since deletion
body:
Ill start from the beginning, but short form

Came home today from 4 days not playing, tried to log in and the launcher just wouldnt boot up. Figured it was a corruption of some sort so after trying to get it open for about an hour, I figured my game needed either repair or straight up to be reinstalled. I uninstalled, re-downloaded the downloader file and attempted to install the client. Hasn't worked.

Right now after double clicking the League Icon on my desktop, the League Logo shows up for about 15 seconds then goes away. I thought it was crashing, so I clicked it again, it tells me that there's an instance of it open already. So from here I figured it was downloading essential things that are needed to actually RUN the downloader, I left it alone for roughly 30 minutes, then got a "Bugsplat" error...

So now Im lost on what to do... Anyone got any ideas? Or had this happen to them before?

replies.body: It almost sounds like your OS doesn't have the right permissions in place to let League launch the way it's supposed to. Let's first try adjusting those [**permissions**](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/204134104-Setting-up-your-Permissions), but if that doesn't work hit me back up!

Sadly Ive already tried these permissions =/ 
Attempted to install as Admin as well and nothing seems to get anything running =/
Also, upon clicking League again its now saying pvp.net Patcher Kernel has stopped working.

Hmmmm the plot thickens....

Typically that Kernel error is a good sign of some kind of permissions issue as well, so it's a little odd that those steps weren't able to help at all. The main problem might be lying elsewhere, and for some reason, it's just causing the same symptoms of permission issues. Let's go ahead and get you a little more one on one help from our tech guys in a [**ticket**](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/requests/new). They can look much closer at what's going on ^_^!

So I've opened a Ticket, but I felt the need to share this as Ive gotten it working now.

Turns out it was a Win10 update that messed up everything. 
I was forced to restore to last Thursday, which thankfully resolved my issue.. Amongst others oddly enough surfacing at the same time. My Blizzard Launcher and Steam were also not launching, starting or even operable.. Weird right? Either way, problem solved, System Restore saved me. I can update and download now :) Thanks for the help Broporo!

Heeeeey I'm glad things got figured out with or without my help xD!

Also, thanks very much for the input on how you ended up fixing it. These tech issues don't always have an end-all-be-all solution, so it's nice to find out new solutions to old problems!
